title: Purchase Order List
text: Within Purchase orders, the Shops list shows all active shops. You must select a shop before the Search button is available. Vendor and/or Status optional fields can be set to narrow down the search. Statuses Draft - A PO that has been saved but not Placed. Placed - When a PO is ready to be sent to the vendor the Place Order button should be used. This marks the PO as an order placed with the vendor. The Quantity and Cost values on a Placed PO may be edited depending on the configuration in Portal - Global Configuration Management under the Inventory section Partly Received - When linked to a Goods Receive some goods have been received but there are some quantities still outstanding. Complete - The PO has been fully received on the linked Goods Receive. Cancelled - When linked to a Goods Receive and not all goods are going to be received the Cancel Remainder button can be used to complete the PO.
description:
Within Purchase orders, the Shops list shows all active shops. You must select a shop before the Search button is available.



Vendor and/or Status optional fields can be set to narrow down the search.



Statuses

Draft - A PO that has been saved but not Placed.

Placed - When a PO is ready to be sent to the vendor the Place Order button should be used. This marks the PO as an order placed with the vendor. The Quantity and Cost values on a Placed PO may be edited depending on the configuration in Portal - Global Configuration Management under the Inventory section

Partly Received - When linked to a Goods Receive some goods have been received but there are some quantities still outstanding.

Complete - The PO has been fully received on the linked Goods Receive.

Cancelled - When linked to a Goods Receive and not all goods are going to be received the Cancel Remainder button can be used to complete the PO.

title: Create New Purchase Order
text: Here you raise Purchase Orders for stock also known as a PO You have the option to 'Create new', you are required to enter a 'Title', 'Vendor' and 'Shop' and optional you can add the 'Order number' and 'Currency'. NOTE: only active shops are shown in the Shop list. NOTE: The currency used will be the one that was set at Vendor creation using the Accepted Currency field this cannot be changed. If you require a different currency then another vendor should be created with the required currency set. Then you can select the items to incorporate into the order, you can auto-populate, bulk import or find them manually. Auto Populate - This feature automatically compares the quantity of stock currently available and the quantity already allocated to other purchase orders (but not yet received), with the predefined Restock Level. Based on this analysis, it generates a suggested quantity for replenishment. The concepts of Reorder Point and Restock Levels are explained in the Matrix. NOTE: Currently, Imagine maintains Reorder and Restock levels at the item level only, without considering specific levels for individual stores. Therefore, it is assumed that the same Reorder and Restock levels apply to all locations. However, provisions should be made for scenarios where Reorder and Restock levels are defined at the Item/Store level. Export Bulk Template - On the Export Bulk Template option, a spreadsheet is exported, named PurchaseOrder_ImportTemplate by default. The Item, Barcode, Name, Variant and Vendor Item No columns on this spreadsheet are read-only. You can alter the Vendor Cost Price and Quantity fields ready for import to the PO. NOTE: Although it is possible to export more than 5000 lines to Excel, if you intend to re-import the same spreadsheet you must make steps to ensure your import file is 5000 lines or less and file size is below 200Kb. If you do not meet these requirements you will receive the below warning. Import Bulk Template - Bulk Import Template and Export Bulk Template allows you to browse and import an excel spreadsheet. Or you can Find the Items Manually, you have a search facility, and it will limit the items to only those from the selected vendor. You also have the option to limit to specific item groups. NOTE: If expected items do not show or are greyed out on the PO check the items 'Do not place on Purchase Order' setting in Standard Attribute on the Matrix tab for Item Details. This option may be controlled by your Head Office. Save - This will save the PO in its current state. The PO has not been placed yet and cannot be linked to a Goods Receive. Place - This tells Imagine the order has been placed with the vendor and no further changes will be made to it. Placed POs can be linked to Goods Receive Notes.

Therefore, it is assumed that the same Reorder and Restock levels apply to all locations. However, provisions should be made for scenarios where Reorder and Restock levels are defined at the Item/Store level.

Export Bulk Template - On the Export Bulk Template option, a spreadsheet is exported, named PurchaseOrder_ImportTemplate by default. The Item, Barcode, Name, Variant and Vendor Item No columns on this spreadsheet are read-only. You can alter the Vendor Cost Price and Quantity fields ready for import to the PO.

NOTE: Although it is possible to export more than 5000 lines to Excel, if you intend to re-import the same spreadsheet you must make steps to ensure your import file is 5000 lines or less and file size is below 200Kb. If you do not meet these requirements you will receive the below warning. 



Import Bulk Template - Bulk Import Template and Export Bulk Template allows you to browse and import an excel spreadsheet.



Or you can Find the Items Manually, you have a search facility, and it will limit the items to only those from the selected vendor. You also have the option to limit to specific item groups.



NOTE: If expected items do not show or are greyed out on the PO check the items 'Do not place on Purchase Order' setting in Standard Attribute on the Matrix tab for Item Details. This option may be controlled by your Head Office.

Save - This will save the PO in its current state. The PO has not been placed yet and cannot be linked to a Goods Receive.

Place - This tells Imagine the order has been placed with the vendor and no further changes will be made to it. Placed POs can be linked to Goods Receive Notes.

title: Download PDF
text: Within the Purchase Order use the Download PDF button located on the top right. After clicking download PDF, make a change to the filename if required and click the "Submit Sheet" button to download the PDF. NOTE: If the shop image (see Creating a New Shop - Image URL) cannot be rendered in the PDF, e.g. the image cannot be found from a website then the shop image will be shown as empty on the PDF.
